translated: May they emanate as the deeds for the sake of sentient beings in all the infinite realms of the ten directions of the universe, with various colors, styles, and modes of behavior, as the many emanations of Samantabhadra.

original: pa mang po rab tu 'byung bar gyur cig / des kyang sems can thams cad kyi phyi nang gi gdon thams cad rab tu zhi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams
analyzed: pa mang po rab tu 'byung bar gyur cig / des kyang sems can thams cad kyi phyi nang gi gdon thams cad rab tu zhi zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams
translated: May they pacify all outer and inner spirits of all sentient beings, and may they attain all the mundane and supramundane perfections, praised by all the tathagatas.

original: cad kyang de dag gis thob par gyur cig par bsams nas byin gyis brlab pa gsum gyis byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: cad kyang de dag gis thob par gyur cig par bsams nas byin gyis brlab pa gsum gyis byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Having contemplated this, one should bless with the three blessings.

original: sems can gyi don byin gyis rlob pa'i rig sngags nam mkha' mdzod du byung bar mdzad pa 'di lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byin gyis rlob pa'i rig sngags nam mkha' mdzod du byung bar mdzad pa 'di lan gsum brjod do //
translated: One should recite three times the vidya-mantra of blessing for the sake of sentient beings, which arose as the sky treasury.

original: na ma:sarba ta th'a ga te bhyo /
analyzed: na ma:sarba ta th'a ga te bhyo /
translated: Namah sarva tathagata bhyo

original: bi shva mu khe bhya:sarba th'a kham aungga te spha ra na hi mam ga ga na kham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bi shva mu khe bhya:sarba th'a kham aungga te spha ra na hi mam ga ga na kham sv'a h'a /
translated: Vishvamukhebhyaḥ sarvatathāgatānāṃ kāya-vāk-citta-ratna-vajra-hṛdaya-sattvādhiṣṭhite svāhā.

original: 'dis lan gsum bzlas pas ji ltar bsams pa'i don rnams sems can gyi khams rnams su de bzhin du 'gyur bas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mkhyen gyi gzhan shes rab chung ba rnams kyis mi shes so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis lan gsum bzlas pas ji ltar bsams pa'i don rnams sems can gyi khams rnams su de bzhin du 'gyur bas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mkhyen gyi gzhan shes rab chung ba rnams kyis mi shes so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: By reciting this three times, whatever one wishes for will be accomplished in the realms of sentient beings, just as it is. The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas know this, but those with little wisdom do not, so has the Blessed One said.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa rnams kyis yid ches par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those in the Bodhisattva Vehicle should have faith in this.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bya zhing 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byas pa des bdag gi lha'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyi yi ge bkod pa la sogs pas bdag nyid lha'i skur bsgyur la yi ge kham dkar po de'i spyi bor gzhag ste
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bya zhing 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byas pa des bdag gi lha'i phyag rgya dang sngags kyi yi ge bkod pa la sogs pas bdag nyid lha'i skur bsgyur la yi ge kham dkar po de'i spyi bor gzhag ste
translated: Thus, having pleased the Tathagatas and accomplished the welfare of all beings, one should transform oneself into the deity's body by arranging one's own divine mudra and mantra syllables, and so forth. Place the white syllable KHAM on the crown of one's head.

original: mdun du lha bzhugs pa'i thugs kar bzlas pa bya ba'i yi ge phreng ba bkod la dbugs dang dran pa rab tu bsdams nas slar sdud pa'i tshig gis non par yid la shib bur mi drag mi dal zhing mi skyo bar ji tsam 'dod pa'i bar du bzlas
analyzed: mdun du lha bzhugs pa'i thugs kar bzlas pa bya ba'i yi ge phreng ba bkod la dbugs dang dran pa rab tu bsdams nas slar sdud pa'i tshig gis non par yid la shib bur mi drag mi dal zhing mi skyo bar ji tsam 'dod pa'i bar du bzlas
translated: Having arranged the rosary of syllables for the recitation in the heart of the deity in front, having thoroughly restrained the breath and the memory, one should recite as much as one wishes, not too forcefully, not too slowly, and not boringly, with the words of the recitation softly in the mind, and ending with the words of gathering.

original: par bya'o // bzlas kar nyid kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te bdag dang lha'i thugs kar bzung la de nas nor bu lag pa g-yas pas blangs nas snyim par bcug la bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sngags bzlas te /
analyzed: par bya'o // bzlas kar nyid kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te bdag dang lha'i thugs kar bzung la de nas nor bu lag pa g-yas pas blangs nas snyim par bcug la bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sngags bzlas te /
translated: Having made the pledge seal of one's deity, holding it at one's heart and the deity's heart, then taking the jewel with the right hand, placing it in one's lap, and reciting the Amṛtakuṇḍali mantra,

original: de'i 'og tu yang yum bzlas snying ga'i thad kar bzung la bzlas pa re la nor bu re re bgrang zhing mgo mjug tu phyag bya'o//
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang yum bzlas snying ga'i thad kar bzung la bzlas pa re la nor bu re re bgrang zhing mgo mjug tu phyag bya'o//
translated: one should hold it at the level of one's heart, and count each recitation with each jewel, and make obeisance at the beginning and end.

original: na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'am tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um /
analyzed: na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'am tsanda ma h'a ro sha na h'um /
translated: namaḥ samantabuddhānāṃ caṇḍamahāroṣaṇa hūṃ

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin ma nus na yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal bar dmigs te sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bar dmigs shing bzlas so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin ma nus na yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal bar dmigs te sems can gyi don phun sum tshogs par 'gyur bar dmigs shing bzlas so //
translated: If one is unable to do as taught, one should do the recitation while visualizing the homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and while visualizing the fulfillment of the aims of sentient beings.

original: de nas ngal lam gtong bar @206b 'dod na bzlas pa gtad de bzlas pa rnams yid kyis dpal phyag na rdo rje la gtams pa'i tshul gyis phul la las kyi rdo rje sems dpar bsgyur te 'phags pa rnams la mchod pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya
analyzed: de nas ngal lam gtong bar @206b 'dod na bzlas pa gtad de bzlas pa rnams yid kyis dpal phyag na rdo rje la gtams pa'i tshul gyis phul la las kyi rdo rje sems dpar bsgyur te 'phags pa rnams la mchod pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du bya
translated: Then, if one wishes to rest or stop, one should dedicate the recitation, and mentally offer the recitations to glorious Vajrapāṇi, and transform into the karma-vajrasattva, and make offerings to the noble ones as taught,

original: zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yang rgya cher bsngo'o //
analyzed: zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yang rgya cher bsngo'o //
translated: and also extensively dedicate the roots of merit.

original: 'phags pa rnams la mchod pa'i phyir bdag las kyi rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la mchod pa'i phyir bdag las kyi rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa ni /
translated: The consecration of oneself as the karma-vajrasattva for the sake of making offerings to the noble ones is:

original: nam: sa manta badzr'a n'am zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam: sa manta badzr'a n'am zhes bya'o //
translated: namaḥ samantabuddhānām.

original: de nas mchod yon dbul te 'di skad brjod pas dpal phyag na rdo rje 'khor dang bcas pa slar gshegs su gsol lo //🔽gdon mi za bar bdag la yang //
analyzed: de nas mchod yon dbul te 'di skad brjod pas dpal phyag na rdo rje 'khor dang bcas pa slar gshegs su gsol lo // gdon mi za bar bdag la yang //
translated: Then, having offered the libation, one should request the departure of glorious Vajrapāṇi together with his retinue, saying this:🔽“Having certainly shown compassion

original: rjes su brtse bar dgongs nas ni //
analyzed: rjes su brtse bar dgongs nas ni //
translated: to me,

original: rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa rnams //
analyzed: rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa rnams //
translated: the Victorious Ones together with their sons

original: ci bde bar yang gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: ci bde bar yang gshegs su gsol //
translated: should depart as they please.”

original: de nas dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya spyi bor gyen du bkrol sngar dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bzhugs pa rnams gshegs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig gsum gyi phyag rgya spyi bor gyen du bkrol sngar dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bzhugs pa rnams gshegs par bya'o //
translated: Then, having released the seal of the three sacred commitments upward on the crown, one should request the departure of those who have been seated with the sacred commitment seal.

original: mtshams bcad pa yang yid kyis dgrol lo //
analyzed: mtshams bcad pa yang yid kyis dgrol lo //
translated: Also, the sealing of the directions should be released mentally.

original: de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlabs la rdo rje sems dpa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas las kyi rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgyas chos kyi dbyings su byin gyis brlabs la rdo rje sems dpa'i sngags dang phyag rgyas las kyi rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab po //
translated: Then, having consecrated the realm of phenomena with the seal of the realm of phenomena, one should consecrate the action vajra being with the mantra and seal of Vajrasattva.

original: spyi bor chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ra yig bsam mo //
analyzed: spyi bor chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ra yig bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine the syllable ra of the realm of phenomena on the crown.

original: rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgyas kyang go bgos la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas dge ba'i las bya bar rab tu bsam zhing ldang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje go cha'i phyag rgyas kyang go bgos la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas dge ba'i las bya bar rab tu bsam zhing ldang ngo //
translated: Having put on the armor of the vajra-seal, having paid homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, one should rise, thinking of doing virtuous actions.

original: langs nas kyang mdo sde zab mo bklag pa la sogs pa dge ba'i las ci nus pa bya'o //
analyzed: langs nas kyang mdo sde zab mo bklag pa la sogs pa dge ba'i las ci nus pa bya'o //
translated: And having risen, one should do whatever virtuous actions one can, such as reading the profound scriptures.

original: de nas zas za ba'i tshe na bdag nyid rigs kyi snying pos bsrungs la sngags 'di bzlas la lan gsum btab ste /
analyzed: de nas zas za ba'i tshe na bdag nyid rigs kyi snying pos bsrungs la sngags 'di bzlas la lan gsum btab ste /
translated: Then, when one is eating, one should protect oneself with the essence mantra of the family, and having recited this mantra three times,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ges sbyangs la zas kyi ro la ma chags par rigs pa dang ldan par ran par bza'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ges sbyangs la zas kyi ro la ma chags par rigs pa dang ldan par ran par bza'o //
translated: one should purify it with the syllable of the dharmadhatu, and eat the food in a suitable amount, without attachment to the taste of the food.

original: na ma:sa manta buddh'a n'am /
analyzed: na ma:sa manta buddh'a n'am /
translated: namas samantabuddhānām

original: aom aamri todbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aamri todbha b'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: om amṛtodbhavāya svāhā

original: nyal ba'i tshe na yang rigs kyi yum gyi snying pos bsrungs nas glo g-yas pas nyal lo //
analyzed: nyal ba'i tshe na yang rigs kyi yum gyi snying pos bsrungs nas glo g-yas pas nyal lo //
translated: And when going to sleep, one should protect oneself with the essence mantra of the mother of the family, and go to sleep on the right side.

original: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du ma nus pas mnyes par bya mi nus so snyam pa'i bsam pa mi bskyed do //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa bzhin du ma nus pas mnyes par bya mi nus so snyam pa'i bsam pa mi bskyed do //
translated: One should not give rise to the thought, “I am unable to please him by acting in accordance with his instructions.”

original: dpal dang ldan pa'i skal ldan pas //
analyzed: dpal dang ldan pa'i skal ldan pas //
translated: The fortunate one endowed with glory

original: zhabs la gtugs nas bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: zhabs la gtugs nas bsdus pa yin //
translated: has compiled it by touching his feet.

original: rnam dag lam chen mdzod yin pas //
analyzed: rnam dag lam chen mdzod yin pas //
translated: Since it is a treasury of the great pure path,

original: skal ldan byang chub mchog gis spyad //
analyzed: skal ldan byang chub mchog gis spyad //
translated: the fortunate one should practice it for supreme enlightenment.

original: dpal phyag na rdo rje sgrub pa'i thabs slob dpon sangs rgyas gsang bas mdzad @207a * //🔽ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal phyag na rdo rje sgrub pa'i thabs slob dpon sangs rgyas gsang bas mdzad @207a * // ba rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of glorious Vajrapāṇi composed by Ācārya Guhyagupta is complete.

original: // / pandi ta chen po de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba 'jam dpal go chas bsgyur cing gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / pandi ta chen po de nyid dang / lo ts'a ba 'jam dpal go chas bsgyur cing gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: It was translated and finalized by the great paṇḍita himself and the translator Jampel Goshri.
